description: Students learn mathematical topics that form an essential background for the study of computer science, including predicate calculus and formal reasoning, elementary number theory, methods of proof, mathematical induction, probability, recursion, efficiency of algorithms, graphs, trees, regular expressions, and automata. Prerequisites: Mathematics 120 or Computer Science 121 or permission of instructor. Offered annually. Counts toward neuroscience concentration.
name: Math Found Computing
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Mathematics 120 or Computer Science 121 or permission of instructor. Offered annually. Counts toward neuroscience concentration.
title: Mathematical Foundations of Computing
